overview:
This class allows you interact with DLP API.

First, install @google-cloud/dlp with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/dlp

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/dlpâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var dlp = require('@google-cloud/dlp')();

Elsewhere

var dlp = require('@google-cloud/dlp')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/dlp are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: DlpServiceClient
methods.description:
The DLP API is a service that allows clients to detect the presence of Personally Identifiable Information (PII) and other privacy-sensitive data in user-supplied, unstructured data streams, like text blocks or images. The service also includes methods for sensitive data redaction and scheduling of data scans on Google Cloud Platform based data sets.

This will be created through a builder function which can be obtained by the module. See the following example of how to initialize the module and how to access to the builder.

methods.name: resultPath
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified result resource name string.

methods.name: matchResultFromResultName
methods.description: Parses the resultName from a result resource.

params.name: resultName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a result resources.

methods.name: getProjectId
methods.description: Get the project ID used by this class.

params.name: callback
params.description: • the callback to be called with the current project Id.

methods.name: inspectContent
methods.description: Find potentially sensitive info in a list of strings. This method has limits on input size, processing time, and output size.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.inspectConfig
params.description:
Configuration for the inspector.

This object should have the same structure as InspectConfig

params.name: request.items
params.description:
The list of items to inspect. Items in a single request are considered "related" unless inspect_config.independent_inputs is true. Up to 100 are allowed per request.

This object should have the same structure as ContentItem

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing InspectContentResponse.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing InspectContentResponse. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: redactContent
methods.description: Redact potentially sensitive info from a list of strings. This method has limits on input size, processing time, and output size.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.inspectConfig
params.description:
Configuration for the inspector.

This object should have the same structure as InspectConfig

params.name: request.items
params.description:
The list of items to inspect. Up to 100 are allowed per request.

This object should have the same structure as ContentItem

params.name: request.replaceConfigs
params.description:
The strings to replace findings with. Must specify at least one.

This object should have the same structure as ReplaceConfig

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing RedactContentResponse.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing RedactContentResponse. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: createInspectOperation
methods.description: Schedule a job scanning content in a Google Cloud Platform data repository.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.inspectConfig
params.description:
Configuration for the inspector.

This object should have the same structure as InspectConfig

params.name: request.storageConfig
params.description:
Specification of the data set to process.

This object should have the same structure as StorageConfig

params.name: request.outputConfig
params.description:
Optional location to store findings. The bucket must already exist and the Google APIs service account for DLP must have write permission to write to the given bucket. Results will be split over multiple csv files with each file name matching the pattern "[operation_id] + [count].csv". The operation_id will match the identifier for the Operation, and the [count] is a counter used for tracking the number of files written. The CSV file(s) contain the following columns regardless of storage type scanned: id, info_type, likelihood, byte size of finding, quote, time_stamp For cloud storage the next two columns are: file_path, start_offset For datastore the next two columns are: project_id, namespace_id, path, column_name, offset.

This object should have the same structure as OutputStorageConfig

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is a gax.Operation object.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is a gax.Operation object. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: listInspectFindings
methods.description: Returns list of results for given inspect operation result set id.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.name
params.description: Identifier of the results set returned as metadata of the longrunning operation created by a call to CreateInspectOperation. Should be in the format of `inspect/results/{id}.

params.name: request.pageSize
params.description: Maximum number of results to return. If 0, the implementation will select a reasonable value.

params.name: request.pageToken
params.description: The value returned by the last ListInspectFindingsResponse; indicates that this is a continuation of a prior ListInspectFindings call, and that the system should return the next page of data.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing ListInspectFindingsResponse.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing ListInspectFindingsResponse. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: listInfoTypes
methods.description: Returns sensitive information types for given category.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.category
params.description: Category name as returned by ListRootCategories.

params.name: request.languageCode
params.description: Optional BCP-47 language code for localized info type friendly names. If omitted, or if localized strings are not available, en-US strings will be returned.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing ListInfoTypesResponse.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing ListInfoTypesResponse. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: listRootCategories
methods.description: Returns the list of root categories of sensitive information.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.languageCode
params.description: Optional language code for localized friendly category names. If omitted or if localized strings are not available, en-US strings will be returned.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing ListRootCategoriesResponse.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing ListRootCategoriesResponse. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

params.name: opts
params.description: • The optional parameters.

params.name: opts.servicePath
params.description: The domain name of the API remote host.

params.name: opts.port
params.description: The port on which to connect to the remote host.

params.name: opts.sslCreds
params.description: A ClientCredentials for use with an SSL-enabled channel.

params.name: opts.clientConfig
params.description: The customized config to build the call settings. See {@link gax.constructSettings} for the format.
